From the diagram, we can see that $ABCD$ is a rectangle, so $AD=BC=4$ and $AB=DC=2$.
Since $MNB$ is a right triangle with legs of length $2$ and $4$, we can find the area of $MBCN$ by starting with the area of the rectangle $ABCD$ and subtracting the area of $\triangle ABD$ and adding the area of $\triangle MNC$.

$$\text{Area of }MBCN=\text{Area of }ABCD-\text{Area of }\triangle ABD+\text{Area of }\triangle MNC.$$
The area of $\triangle ABD$ is $\frac{1}{2}\cdot 2\cdot 4=4$, and the area of $\triangle MNC$ is $\frac{1}{2}\cdot 2\cdot 4=4$.
Substitute the values of the areas of the rectangle and triangles to get $\text{Area of }MBCN=40-4+4$.
